author: tefera
title: Lobby Ethiopia
description: L'Éthiopie est le projet phare de Cardano, avec des succès notables, mais aussi des revers.

f6_assessments.q0: Creating awareness with the general public is certainly a necessity to drive adoption but I fail to see how this proposal has a better chance of doing that through means of draft legislations than doing so through informational campaigns that make clear how value can be created for the general public as the proposer is aiming for a push from the bottom up. Therefore, I feel like this proposal could do much better in a challenge aimed at Scaling up community informational hubs and even merging with existing projects in those challenges.
f6_assessments.q1: Charles himself has stated in the past that filing documents for approval to governmental cabinets on the African continent in a certain time frame can prove to be challenging due to the way things are done. A risk assessment including this and explaining what could be done in case of delays would establish trust in the proposal.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal holds good auditable factors like a roadmap, funding breakdown and KPI to measure progress. But there is somewhat of a contradiction in this proposal that I have not found a clear answer to. I will explain this intuition here in my rationale: There is stated that the people in power don't want change because of threats to individual status of power. Yet it is also stated that a relationship based on monetary incentive would not go far. However, if people in power can improve economic status and create opportunity, that generates more power. So this argument is a paradox. Furthermore, the problem solution appears to be part of the problem statement. Reformatting this could improve the proposal's readability.

f6_assessments.q0:
First, this proposal talks about the creation of an environment of discussion and awareness. However, I do not think that this is really an issue since Cardano has set one of the biggest deals in history with Ethiopian government, primally with the minister of education, to put every primary student on the blockchain. That said, I really think that awareness is not the case.

If the case is the implementation of ADA as an official currency of the country, maybe creating discussions about this subject may help, however the politicians might be waiting those projects that are being carried out to be more mature and have a second look over the blockchain.

Therefore, I do not think that the problem stated is well defined and the scope could be rethink.
f6_assessments.q1:
As I've said, I think the scope should be changed in order to aggregate more value to this proposal. Since there must have lots of discussion amongst the political class (since the deals that have been being closed), I think the discussion presented should have a more economical approach.

That said, maybe adding some economy's specialist would be great and he, as a lobbyist, could make the point of adoption of ADA countrywide.

Besides that, I'm missing a more detailed roadmap and budget, since you are asking for USS 30K (40% of the fund), it seems necessary to pay more attention in these expenses.

When the proposal says that it aims to 'engage civic and political organization leaders' in some months, this is not quite certain. It depends on a enormous amount of variables and shouldn't be exposed here like an assurance.
f6_assessments.q2:
The KPI are superficial here, some of them having no deadline or more explanation in the timetable. Another thing that I'm missing and it should be added is actual numbers (e.g. We aim to have 3 discussions with officials about having ADA as an official currency by the end of April).

Other point that could be improved is the description of the costs, since it's a good amount of this challenge that is being requested.

f6_assessments.q0:
The proposal brings a problem that can be addressed in this challenge, however, it's built upon statements without any backup. That is, even though they might be somewhat true, they might also not be accurate. It's recommended that proposers sustain their statements with more external evidences or relevant data. 

Moreover, the solution to the problem is actually another problem, at least in the way it's written. 

Therefore, the proposal could be improved significantly by adding a more objective rational and connecting better the solution with the problem.
f6_assessments.q1:
No info was provided to assess proposer's experience. 
Considering the context of the challenge and the proposal itself, it's more than necessary to indicate what experience or political articulation have with them. 
Even though the team plans to hire a consultant and legal experts, the proposal does not bring information that the team members will be capable of articulate all the gears.
f6_assessments.q2:
Proposers have given KPIs and a roadmap. However, as the own proposal states, the acceptance in the political level is a huge challenge. And the proposal could be improved (and auditable) by adding challenges in their own roadmap and how the team will overcome them. In addition, one of the ultimate goals of this proposal is to have "DAO legislation 12+ months"
But this is unrealistic in an environment with very low acceptance to the blockchain technology. Any other attempt to legislate the technology in other countries is a proof of how slow is this process of political lobby.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is directly addressing lobbying the market in which Cardano's largest deals exist. There are massive opportunities available for Cardano if the Ethiopian govt was to enact pro-web3 regulation similar to Wyoming's DAO laws but on a national level. This proposal has a lot of promise for African blockchain adoption
f6_assessments.q1: As promising as the proposal is, there are a lot of complications that may arise. The Ethiopian govt is a large slow and complicated bureaucracy that can be difficult for locals and diaspora to navigate (I say this from personal experience and I am sure IOG will agree with me). The plan is good but it may face a large number of challenges
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal does a good job of expressing its goals in a clear and concise manner. It allows the community to understand the ambitions of the community clearly

f6_assessments.q0: Great proposal and idea to influence the regulatory space in Ethiopia. My little concern is coherence and coordination in delivering the goal. The 'how' falls apart from each other. I think a focus solution would be great either educating regulatory stakeholders or promoting public support for drafted bills similar to that of Wyoming state in Ethiopia. The proposal should show how the activities complement each other to help the team achieve its goal.
f6_assessments.q1: I think the team has the requisite experience to deliver the project successfully. The road map KPIs are achievable and should be coherent and clearly define success as well. What would be the outcome of the project?
f6_assessments.q2: Great budget breakdown. The team should commit to documenting their activities through monthly, quarterly, or annual reporting. This would be helpful for tracking and audit as well

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is clearly in line with the main frames of reference set forth by the challenge, and it is true that Africa generally and Ethiopia specifically is a main center por Cardano deployment. Within the lobbying challenge, I believe it might also be interesting in a future iteration of this proposal to not only visualize lobbying for Ethiopia, but rather take advantage of the African Union's headquarters in Addis Ababa to set up a lobbying effort which could, from that geographical vantage point, engage with all AU member nations, both at a bilateral and multilateral level. Both lobbying and legislation drafts could therefore have a multi-jurisdictional impact, minimizing costs and travel expenses, and maximizing the application of single legislative/regulatory drafts (and perhaps even setting standards for the whole continent on their basis).
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal team has a history of engagement and participation within the Cardano community, with relevant experience and multiple parallel proposals. However, the budget for this specific instance should be broken down further, perhaps so as to for example match the roadmap and proposed KPIs and give a more concrete timeline idea so as to distribute funds accordingly as these goals are attained progressively, to account for its feasability. While a timeline from the roadmap in the current proposal is relatively clear, the fund requirements to match them during the implementation and execution are not.
f6_assessments.q2: The budget estimations and proposed KPIs make the end result success terms adequately clear. At the national level, potential interlocutors are preliminarily identified. However, as stated in the previous section, to be auditable the budget for this specific instance should be broken down further, perhaps so as to for example match the proposed KPIs and give a more concrete timeline idea so as to distribute funds accordingly as these goals are attained progressively. For instance, the discussions (with their required budget) could be set at one-month intervals, while the draft legislation is being prepared (with its own specific budget requirements), which could then be a further deliverable, as a basis for engagement with politicians at the national or international level, if the draft were to be made applicable to multiple African countries.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal addresses lobbying from an important perspective--bottom up. Investing in public relations will help support IOHK's efforts at the top level of government. This is  a smart way to utilize this challenge's funds.
f6_assessments.q1: I would have given 5 stars if the team had included information about their background and experience. Other than that, the KPIs, project roadmap and budget breakdown are a solid sign that this project will be properly implemented.
f6_assessments.q2: In order to audit the progress and success, the KPIs, project roadmap and budget breakdown are very important. This team offered all of the needed information.

solution: IOG traite avec les hauts fonctionnaires. Une fois que les gens arrivent au sommet, ils ont très peu d'appétit pour le changement, d'où la nécessité d'une poussée de la base vers le sommet.
experience: Initiateur, coordinateur et traducteur de la localisation Opensource. Organisateur communautaire. Run ITN, membre de Catalyst depuis Fund1, CA, vCA.
